# Scale: Major in B (Mode: Aeolian)

## Brief presentation
The Major scale in B, also known as the Aeolian mode, is a seven-note scale consisting of the following notes: B, C#, D, E, F#, G, and A. In the context of the mode of Aeolian, this scale has a minor tonality, with a somber and introspective sound.

## Notes and Intervals
- B (Root)
- C# (Major 2nd)
- D (Minor 3rd)
- E (Perfect 4th)
- F# (Perfect 5th)
- G (Minor 6th)
- A (Minor 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major scale in B, when used in the Aeolian mode, is often found in genres like rock, metal, and jazz. It offers a melancholic and emotional quality to the music, making it suitable for expressing deeper emotions and introspection. The minor tonality of the Aeolian mode adds a touch of sadness and depth to compositions.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the Major scale in B (Aeolian mode):
1. "Fade to Black" by Metallica
2. "Comfortably Numb" by Pink Floyd
3. "All Along the Watchtower" by Jimi Hendrix
